title-part.text: GATHERING OR REMOVAL OF DOMESTIC OR LIKE REFUSE

reference.text: disinfecting refuse A61L; refuse disintegrators B02C; sorting refuse B03B; B07B; handcarts for transporting refuse receptacles B62B; sack holders B65B67/00; converting refuse into fertilisers C05F; converting refuse into solid fuels C10L; sewers, cesspools E03F; arrangements in buildings for the disposal of refuse E04F17/10; refuse-consuming furnaces F23G;

CPC-specific-text.text: for surgical articles A61B50/36

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

the partitions being movable, e.g. for varying the volume of the compartments

specially adapted for collecting refuse from arrangements in buildings

having means for storing or dispensing spare bags

by suction

reference.text: holders or carriers for hand articles A45F5/00; fastening devices E05C

CPC-specific-text.text: Compressing means incorporated in, or specially adapted for, refuse receptacles
Supports, racks, stands, posts or the like for holding refuse receptacles
for flexible receptables, e.g. bags, sacks
having means for operating lids or covers
Housings, cabinets or enclosures for refuse receptacles
having a waste disposal chute integrally connected to a work top or the like, the refuse receptacle remaining static
having a waste receptacle withdrawn upon opening of the enclosure
the receptacle being rotated about a vertical axis
located underground
Lifting, hoisting, elevating mechanisms or the like for refuse receptacles
for refuse receptacles located underground
Receptacles adapted to store one or more piles of used stackable containers, e.g. beverage cups
Means for facilitating the transport of the receptacle, e.g. wheels, rolls
Receptacles having wheels
relating to noise reduction in receptacles during collecting of refuse, e.g. of glass
relating to the adaptation of receptacles to carry identification means
Refuse receptacles adapted or modified for gathering compostable domestic refuse
Refuse receptacles comprising means for preventing or extinguishing fire
B65F1/1421 takes precedence
for containers in general
with filling openings
with means for locking, fastening or permanently closing thereof
with means for assisting the opening or closing thereof, e.g. springs
Pedal-operated lids
Electromechanically operated lids
provided with means for mounting on receptacles, e.g. hinges
Constructional features of lids or covers
relating to noise reduction, e.g. during opening or closing
relating to means for fixing or latching the lid or cover in a certain angle
relating to means for sealing the lid or cover, e.g. against escaping odors
Water slot seals
relating to safety means, e.g. for children trapped inside the refuse receptacle

title-part.text: Vehicles particularly adapted for collecting refuse

reference.text: vehicles in general B60; driving vehicle equipment or auxiliaries B60K; discharging contents by tilting entire vehicles B65G; wheeled apparatus for emptying sewers or cesspools E03F7/10

title-part.text: with means for discharging refuse receptacles thereinto

CPC-specific-text.text: with crane-like mechanisms
while the receptacles remain in place or are still attached to their supporting means
using suction
Means for facilitating the separation of discharging means from collecting vehicles
the discharging means comprising a device for determining the volume of the content of refuse receptacles
the discharging means comprising a device for determining the weight of the content of refuse receptacles
the discharging means comprising elements for holding the receptacle
having means for adapting to different sized receptacles
Gripper arms for embracing the receptacle
for embracing two or more receptacles
Suction or vacuum heads
Means for locking the rim
Means for locking the side, e.g. via spigots or trunnion pins
Means for locking the front, e.g. via a handle
Constructional features relating to actuating means for lifting or tipping containers
Means for synchronising or coupling two or more discharging devices, e.g. for allowing the discharge of one large container or the simultaneous discharge of two or more containers
Means for vibrating or shaking the containers for facilitating emptying
Means for automatically varying the speed of operation

comprising at least one telescopic arm
capable of moving along the side of the vehicle
capable of rotating around a vertical axis
capable of moving towards or away from the vehicle
the discharging means mounted at the front of the vehicle
between the cab and the collection compartment

the opening means being mounted on the discharging means
Means mounted on the vehicle for supporting the refuse receptacle in the tipping position
the supporting means mounted on the discharging means

guided by tracks, channels, slots or the like provided on the vehicle
